pageContext.claim: “2.6 [percent gross domestic product growth] is a number that nobody thought they'd see for a long period of time. Remember, I was saying we will hit 3 at some point in the not-too-distant future. And everybody smiled and they laughed and they thought we'd be at 1.”
pageContext.analysis: GDP growth was 3.6 percent in the third quarter of 2016. Trump during the campaign pledged to achieve 4 percent annual growth, which most economists said was unrealistic. Since he took office, the president misleadingly has said he pledged three percent growth.
